div.h3: Providing an educational experience empowering students to maximize their potential

li.a: 2019-20 PreK–12 Students Assessment Family Overview Guide
Pre K-12 Student Assessment Family Overview Guide
Maximo - New Maintenance Work Order System
NEW Maintenance Work Order Sign Up

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap; color: #272727
span.div: All district communications can be found on the right hand side of this page. During an emergency such as this one, the district uses this system to email everyone with important information. If you are not getting these emails, you may have forgotten to sign up or you unsubscribed at some point. Click “Stay Connected” in the upper right hand corner to sign up for these alerts. Make sure to sign up for the "District Information" list. You can choose to sign up for building level message as well.

Helping children manage emotions during this unprecedented time can be difficult. We have staff and resources available to help. Our Wellness Coach, Jessica Fosnaugh, MA.Ed, LPCCS, is available to talk with children or families who may be struggling during this time as are our school counselors. Please visit Jessica's website here or reach out to your school counselor for more information.
In addition, here are additional resources that can help support children talk with their children during this difficult time.

li.a: Supprting your Child's Health and Wellbeing During Ohio’s Ordered School-Building Closure
CBS News Report with Dr. Lisa Damour on managing anxiety
How to manage anxiety, stay active, and focus on your family's well-being.
Talking to Children About COVID-19 (Coronavirus): A Parent Resource

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap; color: #272727

br.span: News coverage of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and how it is impacting nations around the world may prompt you to wonder what safety practices Chagrin Falls Schools has in place to minimize the spread of illness. In addition to closely partnering with public health agencies to keep up-to-date on this evolving situation, Chagrin Falls Schools is following existing safety practices to minimize the spread of illness and to encourage good health. Safe school plans are in place at each of our schools. We encourage preventative actions, including:

ul.style: color: #272727; font-family: "Roboto Condensed", sans-serif; font-size: 16px; background-color: #ffffff

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If running a fever (>100.0), it is recommended that students remain at home until the fever has been gone for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing medicines.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Using respiratory etiquette (e.g. covering coughs, using tissue and no touch trash cans).
